lines.text: Tip your hat when you speak to a lady!
I will... when I speak to a lady.
What started you on the warpath, Yellow Hand?

Where sun rise, white man's land. Where sun set, Indian land. White man come, take our land, kill buffalo, our food. White man promise us food. White man lie. Now Cheyenne buy white man thunder stick. Soon war drum sound in all Indian land. All tribes ride with Yellow Hand. We drive white man, like buffalo, away back to rising sun. Yellow Hand has spoken.
Hey, why don't you get a haircut?
Short hair makes the Indians mad, and they're mad enough already.
Will, does he kill like that?
Ain't a corpse-maker like him, honey!
That river clipper is saying good-bye to you, ma'am. Now you're going to have three long days of this prairie clipper.
But tomorrow is Sunday. Do we have to ride on Sunday?
Well, there's no Sunday west of Junction City, no law west of Hayes City and no God west of Carson City.
[last lines]
It shall be as it was in the past... Not with dreams, but with strength and with courage... Shall a nation be molded to last.
Keep your hands off your guns or there will be more dead men here than this town can afford to bury!
I'm not armed, Mr. Hickok, I'm not armed!
I'll give you three minutes to fix that. I'll be waiting outside.
I'm just leaving town.
You're not leaving town unless dead men can walk.
Bill Hickok, you ornery son-of-a-mule. You wouldn't give a bad dime to a sick kid, would you?
You might be right, Calamity.
No, I ain't. I know I ain't worth a bad dime.

Son, one of these days, you're going to grow up and you ought to know about women. You see, the thing is this - women are... uh, well, they're uh... Well, son, I can tell you what an Indian will do to ya, but you never know what a woman will do.
It's easier sliding up Niagara Falls than it is to understand a woman.
You're a mule-headed man, Bill Hickok.
Women and me don't agree.

[Seeing McCall smoking a cigarette]
Hey! Your toothpick is on fire!
How do you like your bacon, Bill?
I like my bacon fine.
What are you smoking? Chalk?
Maybe you're just bein' nice to me because you think you won't ever see me again.
Sure, sure I'll see you again. This is a big country and trails cross sometimes.
But we can't sell rifles to the Indians!
I think we can... to peaceable Indians.

[to Calamity Jane]
Indians will sell anything. They might sell you!
I'm gonna be a big man in this country.

[Sarcastically]
You're gonna have to grow a foot, won't yuh?

[to Buffalo Bill on his recent marriage]
I see she hasn't cut your hair... yet.
